title: Americans help volunteers with Mexico quake rescue effort
description:
(22 Sep 2017) US rescue workers helped Mexican rescuers dig through the rubble of a collapsed building south of Mexico City on Thursday, as they hunted for survivors following Tuesday's 7.1 magnitude earthquake.
Several families lived in the building on Tlalpan Avenue.
Volunteers in the neighbourhood asked drivers and passers-by to keep silent so that rescuers could listen out for cries for help. 
At least 273 people are known to have died.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/23827dedaa1c9640dd205dc997daf9dc 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
